The Abipones think it a great happiness to be buried in a wood under the shade of trees, and grieve for the fate of those that are interred in achapel, calling them captives of the Father. In the dread of such sepulture, they at first shunned baptism. They dig a very shallow pit to place the body in, that it may not be pressed by too great a weight of earth heaped over it.
